content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
• No new permanent structures have been successfully established during these steps. In several recovery updates the agent attempted to supply a Lab for Automation Science Packs by placing one at (0.5, 2.5), but all placement and crafting attempts failed due to missing inventory and sub-ingredient issues.
• Processing operations made use of existing smelting facilities. Although not newly constructed, the agent interacted with two furnaces for resource processing:
  – Iron Smelting Furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=5.0) used to convert iron ore into iron plates.
  – Copper Smelting Furnace at Position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0) used to transform copper ore into copper plates.
These entities are referenced solely for their production role and do not constitute a multi-component structure assembled by the agent.

ERROR TIPS
• API Usage Errors with get_entities
  – Avoid using unsupported keywords (e.g. ‘radius’) or incorrect positional arguments. Verify the function’s signature and call get_entities with only the accepted parameters.
• Lab Placement and Inventory Validation
  – Ensure that a Lab is available in the inventory before attempting placement. Checking inventory preconditions will help avoid “No lab in inventory” errors.
• Handling NoneType Returns in Entity Retrieval
  – When filtering results from get_entities, confirm that the return value is not None. Implement fallback logic (such as defaulting to an empty list) to prevent iteration over a None value.
• Lab Crafting and Resource Chain Shortfalls
  – Multiple lab crafting attempts failed due to missing sub-ingredients (e.g. iron-gear-wheel, electronic-circuit, copper-cable). Fully assess required intermediate items and ensure that the complete production chain (smelting resources and crafting components) is operational prior to lab crafting.
• Consolidated Resource Management
  – Persistent shortages in essential resources (iron-plates, copper-plates, and their derived products) have contributed to lab crafting failures. Review and balance resource production to meet the recipe prerequisites before initiating further lab production attempts.
